scenario_text.value:
(After that, we passed through the waterway
safely and made it this far.)

(Still, we made it this far without seeing
enemies? Like the calm before a storm...)

One of the Four Sovereign Monsters should be
around here somewhere.
Shh! Be quiet!
Huh?

Everybody hide, quick! We need to move slowly
and carefully!
What is it, Shuuji?
Just shut up and hide! I’ll explain later.
Okay...

(Shuuji and Minoru look deadly serious. I’ll
just do as they say for now.)
What’s going on?

It’s something that started happening while
you were gone.

We kept running into trouble, time and time
again, the instant we let down our guards.

Believe me, I’ve had enough of suddenly being
grabbed around the throat from behind.

So now we go on alert as soon as we think
something’s wrong. No second guessing, okay?
Okay, sure.

(It’s not just those two⁠—everyone’s
practically holding their breath.)

(You can cut the tension with a knife. We’re
on high alert. You could hear a pin drop...)
All right, we’re good.

Phew... Now, let’s get back to searching for
the shrine.
Yeah, I don’t see anything that looks right.

If only they had a sign or something. “This
way to the Sovereign Monsters Shrine!”

Not likely. According to the Professor, those
Monsters guard the four main directions.

Not even Jijimon could tell us much. They’re
definitely going to be well hidden.

Ugh, sounds like we’ve got our work cut out
for us. Got any clues, Takuma?

I wish I did. Agumon, do you sense anything
nearby?
Hmm... Nope, sorry, Takuma.
Still, I feel like we’re close.
Uh, what makes you say that?

Well, we’re really far north, but there isn’t
much fog, is there?

You’re right. We heard the fog was thick up
this way, but there’s not much here.

It’s like the eye of a storm. Because it’s
calm, we know we’re in the middle of things.
Sounds like we’re almost there, Shuuji.

Yes, we’re on the right track. We’ll have to
look around, so let’s not lose heart.

Everyone, we’re going to split up and search
this place. Meet back here in an hour.

(Everyone nods in agreement, and scatters in
response to Shuuji’s instructions.)
(Now, which way should I go?)
